body:
Comment 3: 
I could be mistaken, but I think the issue here is that godoc doesn't know which
unexported types with exported methods will ever be seen outside of your package.

I suppose it might be useful to have another "m" parameter, such as "exported", that
shows all exported identifiers (default view) plus any unexported types that have at
least one exported method. This, however, will also include a bunch of internal types
and methods that will never actually be seen outside of your package. They are
technically exported, but unreachable.
